E756E896B6F14778A85D57EEC491ADD7.description: Speak in complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification.

B0430A7D5B2F489680D5EE0D06DDECE3.description: Demonstrate fluid reading at an understandable pace, adding visual displays when appropriate to emphasize or enhance certain facts or details.

803048A1EE984874AFF1D31347A323DF.description: Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking clearly at an understandable pace.

56D20FF15FFF4FF8974EDE855581F75D.description: Standard 2: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas

7D279776EB5945BABE762FB47946D867.description: Ask and answer questions about information from a speaker, offering appropriate elaboration and detail.

B71C7C417BC0404CBC9E79C8669EBA60.description: Determine the main ideas and supporting details of information presented in a variety of media and formats.

48D11EDD669E44149C42AF89E011160B.description: Explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

34AF93EF91FD4E00A059460F533001FA.description: Ask questions to check understanding of information presented, stay on topic, and link their comments to the remarks of others.

E5D7E51C5F6B4D9898822A782242AE87.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion),

88CCE14271F44E079D8B9DEEADE470EA.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with a variety of partners on grade 3 topics and texts, building on othersâ€™ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

1ACF9B22583A4C83A14DAE3A2CD3F0E7.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among related words that describe states of mind or degrees of certainty (e.g., knew, believed, suspected, heard, wondered).

E17BC75224ED4020A9BC635BA81F5000.description: b. Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe people who are friendly or helpful).

2E8FA54813174E3B9E69139198CAAD7B.description: Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context (e.g., take steps).

16EC961698ED4B108304F314E6B7D64E.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

695BE342701A4935B009F69CDF189365.description: Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., company, companion).

52FCA32572E04547B32259A1BB401EF4.description: Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known affix is added to a known word (e.g., agreeable/disagreeable, comfortable/uncomfortable, care/careless, heat/preheat).

62789B2F15974E6C940744C33E82002D.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

2E99AF6BD2C54A7BBBCE6CA81052B5E9.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content. Clarification: In grade 3, we introduce strategies to make meaning of words and phrases.  The following are specific foundational strategies.

B1915C5ED6044C5F9E3CF4DF5FF4F683.description: Use glossaries and beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases.

AEBC82FD26ED479192F7886A1D550553.description: Recognize and observe differences between the formal conventions and informal use of spoken and written English.

3F47C8F827A14FD9968983DBCA620120.description: Choose words and phrases for effect.

FEC5F61BC8564860ADCB33B433CA9FF4.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, or reading.

F8B4D620ABAB40249F463BA98B053CC4.description: Consult reference materials, including dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings.

8D4894EB0D984F34BB4D49CFD7643F13.description: Use spelling patterns and generalizations (e.g., word families, position-based spellings, syllable patterns, ending rules, meaningful word parts) in writing words.

5FDC63FCAD264E46B2DF79249D1A9411.description: Apply spelling rules for adding suffixes to base words (e.g., sitting, smiled, cries, happiness).

AEDD600396E54CEAAD407231CB146A8D.description: Change nouns to their possessive forms.

8647AFF7E01442BCAAA81B40968D9E05.description: Use commas for a variety of purposes correctly.

CCF0F9C747E74C5981EE88A4207FA477.description: Use conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

8178BE73178F40AAB11C783D5D7C0E90.description: Form and use comparative and superlative adjectives (good, better, best) and adverbs (fast, faster, fastest), and choose between them depending on what is to be modified. h. Use coordinating (for, and, nor, but, or, yet,  so) and subordinating conjunctions ("Since I didn't study, I did poorly on the test."). i. Construct simple, compound, and complex sentences.

656797C438CB4B4AB68FE0C6A836C091.description: Form and use the simple (e.g., I walked; I walk; I will walk) verb tenses.

BB26AEF173DB47DB8FA674B34F50C41F.description: Form and use regular and irregular verbs.

08A8510023894C2DB8A4B5CD3F6B03DA.description: Use abstract nouns (e.g., childhood, friendship, courage).

CF46C72F7A26478692290CFA7ED86E9F.description: Form and use regular and irregular plural nouns.

07BD4D76E8E74B9CAEB09C2A2C8DE8CD.description: Identify and explain the function of nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives, and adverbs in general and their functions in particular sentences.

FD6D6857888240A0B1E9A456BC852DEE.description: Use conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

7FF88742B51444ACB6A196E8DD4E7A11.description: Students will be able to write two five sentence paragraphs, including a introductory paragraph and a supporting second paragraph on a topic that uses correct capitalization, end punctuation and transitional words.

1F782C888E49432A8DAD58F9B33B5EDA.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of disciplines, specific tasks, purposes, and audiences including for enjoyment and self-expression.

28A19B1ABDC2444D9FE3350005611CF4.description: Recall information from experiences or gather information from print and digital sources; take brief notes on sources and sort evidence into provided categories.

8D91F0658BB34C479BFD25FD5AEE91A5.description: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge about a topic.                                                 Clarification 1: Teachers should model appropriate use of search terms and process in using search engines; i.e. Google.

00B1FFB5BBCE49C4A2074B404017C541.description: Standard 3:  Research to Build and Present Knowledge

A0003350C0C64B61B016BDBA7B2BF1BF.description: Students will use technology tools to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

695B2052041D46AA9E1A7BC6099A153A.description: Students will produce writing using the writing process (pre-writing, brainstorming, rough draft, editing, revising, final draft and publishing) in which the development and organization are appropriate to task and purpose.

16DC4CFFF01841A38F251AD3C28D3216.description: Standard 2:   Production and Distribution of Writing

880246868F5346A0ADEA7B11944605C4.description: Write at least a five-sentence paragraph narrative to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. Clarification 1: Establish a situation and introduce a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.  Clarification 2: Use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop experiences and events or show the response of characters to situations. Clarification 3: Use transition words and phrases to signal event order. Clarification 4: Provide a sense of closure.

4985ADE45205443D91965B9B0E19B291.description: Write at least a five-sentence paragraph that introduces informative or explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.                                                                                                                                   Clarification 1:  Introduce a topic and group related information together; include illustrations when useful to aiding comprehension. Clarification 2: Write a second paragraph to develop the topic with facts, definitions, and details.  Clarification 3: Use linking words and phrases (e.g., also, another, and, more, but) to connect ideas within categories of information.  Clarification 4: Provide a concluding statement.

433EC1740A874A69AAE0E69BAA9EF0CF.description: Write at least a five-sentence paragraph that introduces an opinion, topic or text, states an opinion, and create an organizational structure that lists reasons. Clarification 1: Write a second paragraph that provides reasons that support the opinion. Clarification 2: Use linking words and phrases (e.g., because, therefore, since, for example) to connect opinion and reasons.  Clarification 3: Provide a concluding statement.

D9C604FAB865469AA608EB28C1417C87.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, on a third grade level.

B3FF3F3BBA7E4B019D5FA0CCDCE01512.description: Standard 4: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

90005355ABED496CA76F77BE724F7F60.description: Compare and contrast the themes, settings, and plots of stories written by the same author about the same or similar characters (e.g., in books from a series).

C07CB26500804C1BBB20BE86003FDD64.description: Explain how mood, perspective, aspects of charactor or settings, can be understood through interpretation of illustrations or images in connection to a story or text.

1F81984AE02C4998BB31D25B322E5E70.description: Standard 3: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas

F3F0DAECDB094EBBBD4A66B15C57798F.description: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the narrator or those of the characters. (perspective)

F4AA76CB8F0C485F9B6C9D9CDE225B5C.description: Refer to parts of stories, dramas, and poems when writing or speaking about a text, using terms such as chapter, scene, and stanza and how it contributes to the flow of the story; describe how each successive part builds on earlier sections.

DE4143AE800F48A999E07B424B33F77D.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, distinguishing literal from nonliteral language. See LAFS.3.L.3.5 in Vocabulary Acquisition and Use

813901371CC442AA933E214C47F892B9.description: Describe characters in a story (e.g., their traits, motivations, or feelings) and explain how their actions contribute to the sequence of events.

ADAAF9EE8C4149DDB4E14F3787F31239.description: Recount stories, including parables, fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures; determine the central message, lesson, or moral and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.

8381D74741F840AA92F46CA32E86884F.description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

54B4BD5A168B440A9AEC8B27877DDAAC.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, at the 3 grade level text complexity, independently and proficiently.

78664A2988FE4FE8957E85709E402757.description: Standard 4: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

7452E946CB33449A94C1084299CD2105.description: Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.

F54DE09DEC1E49B7A598A2C093F957F6.description: Identify cause and effect in a given text.

37ED7FE9A54840D6B3A63BC102B86757.description: Use information gained from illustrations (e.g., maps, photographs) and the words in a text to demonstrate understanding of the text (e.g., where, when, why, and how key events occur).

20CCD80723E140D084EDCC32A7D082D5.description: Standard 3: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas

A375142522F249B0BDCB91D7EC356FC8.description: Identify the logical transitions between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g., comparison, first/second/third in a sequence).

259F4B67D6E7435A80B04A03345A5C1D.description: Independently identify the main purpose of a text, including what the author wants to answer, explain, or describe.

7B176D0270C64254882EA9F75FB5C9D7.description: Use text features and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) to locate information relevant to a given topic efficiently.

B85D778B6EE84517AA8B1453D0D1FAF2.description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 3 topic or subject area.

D2FF364655AB4289AFA9E5AC5FCFF05C.description: Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text, using language that pertains to time, sequence, and cause/effect.

C5BCEB46BC204A00AACD1B9171FB6BA3.description: Determine the main idea of a text; recount the key details and explain how they support the main idea.

59E356AA854F47299E157C19A4A7E8CD.description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

C4B8467B61704D68B74C0A9F37F7DEA0.description: Students will be able to fluently read connected text at a rate of 112 Words Correct Per Minute (WCPM) with greater than 96% accuracy (50th percentile).  For the purpose of fluency, the End-of-Year target was derived from range of researched-based high-frequency word list including Dibels.

41B74718553D40199D45ECFBF8229127.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

291EDD75273741E6A0B7E77FE9B4AB50.description: Read on-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.

C985E1C70ADD46D694A272CD7FE3BF39.description: Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.

DB8DD07258824630B434E5E1DE470E17.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

22FE2E8FE548486C87B1EF6620B37627.description: Decode words with common Latin suffixes.

0F3C4995ED554A63A1951DD9F3E56B40.description: Identify and know the meaning of the most common prefixes and derivational suffixes.

BA3EF89A77284EA49B5A19EC366B8083.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.
